intro: Zappania prismatica, commonly known as the prismatic sedge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. Zappania prismatica is often found in wetland environments, where it thrives in moist, swampy conditions.
